Text: Blessed is he who has regard for the weak. The LORD delivers him in the day of trouble.
Context: This verse highlights God’s favor upon those who care for the weak, suggesting that such compassion is rewarded by divine protection.

Text: The LORD protects and preserves him. He is blessed in the land and You do not surrender him to the desire of his enemies.
Context: The assurance of God‘s protecting presence for the compassionate person is emphasized here.

Text: The LORD sustains him on his sickbed; in his illness, You restore him to full health.
Context: The theme of divine care continues, with a promise of healing and personal attention from God during illness.

Text: I said, ”O LORD, be gracious to me; heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.“
Context: The psalmist shifts to a personal plea for mercy, acknowledging sin and the need for spiritual healing.

Text: My enemies speak evil of me: “When will he die and his name perish?”
Context: The psalmist reveals the malicious intent of his adversaries, who wish for his demise.

Text: When one comes to visit, he speaks deceitfully; he stores up malice in his heart; when he goes out, he tells it abroad.
Context: The deceit of the psalmist’s enemies is recounted, portraying their insincere behavior and gossip.

Text: All who hate me whisper together against me; against me they devise my harm.
Context: This verse continues the theme of conspiracy among the psalmist‘s enemies.

Text: “They say, ’A vile disease has beset him; he will never get up from the place where he lies.‘“
Context: The psalmist conveys the cynicism and scorn of his enemies, who claim that his illness is a permanent affliction.

Text: Even my close friend, whom I trusted, he who shared my bread, has lifted up his heel against me.
Context: The sense of betrayal reaches its pinnacle as the psalmist describes being wronged by one he considered a trusted friend.

Text: But You, O LORD, be gracious to me and raise me up, that I may repay them.
Context: Despite the hostility faced, the psalmist turns to God again requesting vindication and the strength to face his adversaries.

Text: By this I know that You delight in me: my enemy does not shout in triumph over me.
Context: The psalmist finds assurance in the lack of victory by his enemies, interpreting it as a sign of God’s favor.

Text: Because of my integrity You uphold me and set me in Your presence forever.
Context: The psalmist expresses a calm assurance that his moral uprightness will lead to eternal fellowship with God.

Text: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Amen and Amen.
Context: The psalm concludes with a doxology, offering timeless praise to God and affirming His eternal sovereignty.
